info.name: Manufacturing
info.description:
Endpoints used in **Ibisa Manufacturing** and some customized for **Lab Milanes**.

> **Note:**

> - All the endpoints customized for Laboratorio Milanes are filed under the *Milanes* folder.

item.name: Equipments

request.description: List all the Capability Tests performed to the equipments

Search all equipmentCapabilityTests by any of its **parameters**:

| Parameter| Type	| Required |
| ------- | ----	| -------|
| id	   | Long	|  F	   |
| code	   | String	|  F	   |
| description | String	|  F	   |
| hierarchyScope | String	|  F	   |
| name	   | String	|  F	   |
| location | String	|  F	   |
| version  | String	|  F	   |
Create a new EquipmentCapabilityTest

]

request.description:
Update a set of Equipments at the same time based on the info provided.

**EquipmentLabel** may have the following values:
- ENTERPRISE,
- SITE,
- AREA,
- WORKCENTER,
- WORKUNIT,
- STORAGEUNIT

Update an equipment by ID

where **EquipmentLabel** may have the following values:
- ENTERPRISE,
- SITE,
- AREA,
- WORKCENTER,
- WORKUNIT,
- STORAGEUNIT
Delete an Equipment by id
Delete all equipments configured

item.description: Set of endpoints to manage the equipments

item.name: Events

request.description:
Create a new eventDefinition according to the *codes* and *EventType*

The **codes** values may be:
- ADQUIRE,
- INITIATE,
- START,
- HOLD,
- RESTART,
- STOP,
- ABORT,
- COMPLETE,
- REMOVE,


The **EventTypes** values may be:
- WORKFLOW_NODE_COMMAND

Update a single eventDefinition by Id

The **codes** values may be:
- ADQUIRE,
- INITIATE,
- START,
- HOLD,
- RESTART,
- STOP,
- ABORT,
- COMPLETE,
- REMOVE,


The **EventTypes** values may be:
- WORKFLOW_NODE_COMMAND

Update a set of eventDefinition at the same time.

The **codes** values may be:
- ADQUIRE,
- INITIATE,
- START,
- HOLD,
- RESTART,
- STOP,
- ABORT,
- COMPLETE,
- REMOVE,


The **EventTypes** values may be:
- WORKFLOW_NODE_COMMAND
Get a list of EventTypes and its properties
Create a new EventTypes record
Update a single eventType by ID
Update a set of eventType at the same time given a JSON
List all events available
Get event properties by ID

Search events by any of its properties:
- entityType, 
- entityId, 
- eventType, 
- action

Create a new event according to the entry data:
 
**EntityType** values:
- WORK_DIRECTIVE: to initiate/save a workDirective
- PROCESS: to start, abort, remove a running process
- USER_TASK: to complete a task of a process,
- SUBPROCESS: to start, abort, remove a running subprocess
- WORKFLOW_NODE

**EventDefinition** Code values:
- INITIATE: Initiate a process,
- START: Start a task,
- HOLD: pause/hold a process or taks,
- RESTART,
- STOP,
- ABORT: abort a process,
- COMPLETE: complete a task,
- REMOVE: Delete a process
delete an event by ID

Update a single event by ID

**EntityType** values:
- WORK_DIRECTIVE: to initiate/save a workDirective
- PROCESS: to start, abort, remove a running process
- USER_TASK: to complete a task of a process,
- SUBPROCESS: to start, abort, remove a running subprocess
- WORKFLOW_NODE

**EventDefinition** Code values:
- INITIATE: Initiate a process,
- START: Start a task,
- HOLD: pause/hold a process or taks,
- RESTART,
- STOP,
- ABORT: abort a process,
- COMPLETE: complete a task,
- REMOVE: Delete a process

Update a set of events at the same time given a JSON data

**EntityType** values:
- WORK_DIRECTIVE: to initiate/save a workDirective
- PROCESS: to start, abort, remove a running process
- USER_TASK: to complete a task of a process,
- SUBPROCESS: to start, abort, remove a running subprocess
- WORKFLOW_NODE

**EventDefinition** Code values:
- INITIATE: Initiate a process,
- START: Start a task,
- HOLD: pause/hold a process or taks,
- RESTART,
- STOP,
- ABORT: abort a process,
- COMPLETE: complete a task,
- REMOVE: Delete a process

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: access-control-allow-methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-max-age
header.description: Indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached in seconds.

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: content-type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: strict-transport-security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: transfer-encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: x-application-context
header.description: Custom header

header.name: x-authtoken
header.description: Custom header

header.name: x-content-type-options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: x-frame-options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: x-xss-protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

- MIXED

header.name: access-control-allow-credentials
header.description: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true. When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.

header.name: access-control-allow-headers
header.description: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

header.name: access-control-allow-methods
header.description: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource. This is used in response to a preflight request.

header.name: access-control-allow-origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.name: access-control-max-age
header.description: Indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached in seconds.

header.name: cache-control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: content-type

header.name: date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: strict-transport-security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: transfer-encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: x-content-type-options

header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

request.description:
Search materialLots by any of its **parameters**:

| Parameter| Type	| Required |
| ------- | ----	| -------|
| id	   | Long	|  F	   |
| code	   | String	|  F	   |
| description | String	|  F	   |
| assemblyRelationship | AssemblyRelationShip	|  F	   |
| assemblyType | assemblyType	|  F	   |
| hierarchyScope | String	|  F	   |
| quantity | Float	|  F	   |
| status | MaterialLotStatus	|  F	   |
| unitOfMeasure | String	|  F	   |
| quantity | Float	|  F	   |
| materialDefinition | Long	|  F	   |
| storageLocation | Long	|  F	   |
| hierarchyScope | String	|  F	   |
| location | Long	|  F	   |


where **AssemblyRelationShip** may have the following values:
- OPTIONAL,
- PERMANENT,
- TRANSIENT

and **assemblyType** may be:
- OPTIONAL,
- PHYSICAL,
- LOGICAL
- 
and **materialLotStatus** may be:
- RELEASED,
- APPROVED,
- BLOCKED,
- IN_PROCESS,
- IN_QUALITY_CHECK

item.name: Repository
item.description:
Some endpoints are not explicitly defined in this list but rather are contained in restRepository and are exposed automatically by it (mainly GET methods).

For example **personProperties** wich URL isn't defined above but exits and show the properties of a user/person:
- {{url}}/mes/personProperties contained in *PersonPropertyRepository*

Here's a list of the *restRepository* available

| EndPoint| Repository	|
| ------- | ----	|
| EventDefinitionNotificationRecipients  | EventDefinitionNotificationRecipientRepository	|
| eventDefinitionProperties  | EventDefinitionPropertyRepository	|
| eventDefinitions  | EventDefinitionRepository	|
| eventProperties  | EventPropertyRepository	|
| events  | EventRepository	|
| eventTypes  | EventTypeRepository	|
| failures  | FailureRepository	|
| materialClasses  | MaterialClassRepository	|
| materialDefinitionProperties  | MaterialDefinitionPropertyRepository	|
| materialDefinitions  | MaterialDefinitionRepository	|
| materialLotProperties  | MaterialLotPropertyRepository	|
| materialLots  | MaterialLotRepository	|
| materialSubLotProperties  | MaterialSubLotPropertyRepository	|
| materialSubLots  | MaterialSubLotRepository	|
| materialTestSpecifications  | MaterialTestSpecificationRepository	|
| personnelClassProperties  | PersonnelClassPropertyRepository	|
| personnelClasses  | PersonnelClassRepository	|
| personnel  | PersonRepository	|
| qualificationTestResults  | QualificationTestResultRepository	|
| qualificationTestSpecifications  | QualificationTestSpecificationRepository	|

request.description: get all process instances running
Get a single process instance by id
get all variables defined in a Process Instance by processInstanceId
Get a list of all active tasks running
Complete a tasks by id
Claim a task to a certain user by id. So that person become de owner of the task and that person can complete it
Delegate a task to someone else. So that other person becomes the new owner and the status change to delegated.
get all usertasks by owner name
List historic task
Create a process instance by processDefinition ID
Create a new Process Instance by Key

item.name: [GET] get process Instance. by Id and variables

request.description: Get process instance by id including the process variables
Get process instance BPMN diagram
Delete a process intance by id

item.name: [GET] get all task variables by taskId

request.description:
Get all task variables from a task by taskId.
It can include a *"scope"* parameter. 

>- When none especified, returns all variables (local and global).
>- ?scope=local returns only **local** variables
>- ?scope=global returns only **global** variables

Create variables to a task by task Id

- **scope** can be: local or global. When omitted, *global* is assumed
- **type** can be: string, double, integer and boolean.
Update a variable from a task by taskId
Search tasks by conditions met in the payload data, like variables
Get historinc process instances

item.description:
**Floawble** is the BPM platform used to run the workflows, the engine for the processes. a *BPMN-based* tool. Flowable has a complete API of it own to interact wiht the engine and the processes (templates, instances or historic), however the current endpoints listed are the ones we used the most for general purposes.

Click [here][1], for the complete *Flowable REST API Documentation*.

[1]: http://www.flowable.org/docs/userguide/index.html#restApiChapter
